title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Thousands of tourists in costumes filled Salem, Massachusetts, on Halloween, visiting haunted museums and local attractions.
Downtown Salem featured markets, street performances, and spooky decor as visitors celebrated Halloween on Essex Street.
The Salem Witch Trials Memorial saw visitors leaving flowers and offerings, highlighting Salem's historical significance on Halloween.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton accused President Trump of abusing girls with Epstein, offering no proof during an MSNBC interview.
Moulton claimed Trump is in the 'Epstein files' and criticized Republicans for not prioritizing the working class.
Joe Scarborough challenged Moulton's accusations, emphasizing there is no evidence of Trump's involvement in such crimes.

title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Brian Walshe's trial will begin with jury selection on Nov. 18, after a mental health evaluation and pre-trial conference.
Judge Krupp has ordered federal authorities to preserve cellphone evidence potentially relevant to multiple Norfolk County cases.
Cellphone evidence includes information from former State Police Trooper Michael Proctor, with restrictions on public disclosure of sensitive data.

title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Star Market on Massachusetts Turnpike in Newton reopened Friday following a temporary closure due to an asbestos scare.
Health officials shut down the store after asbestos was potentially released during stockroom demolition work.
Air and surface samples detected no asbestos risk; MassDEP confirmed the stockroom area is sealed and contained.

title: ‘He has everything to score 50’: Morgan Geekie is evolving into an elite goal scorer for Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Morgan Geekie is on pace to score 57 goals this season, featuring a powerful 95.68 mph shot against the Islanders.
David Pastrnak praised Geekie, claiming his shot is the strongest on the team, citing his goal-scoring instinct.
Geekie has scored in six consecutive games, contributing to the Bruins' power play ranked 13th in the NHL.

title: Celtics reportedly exercise team option for 2024 1st-round pick Baylor Scheierman
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics exercise $2.74 million team option on Baylor Scheierman for the 2026-2027 season.
Scheierman, a 6-foot-6 forward, was the 30th overall pick in the 2024 NBA Draft out of Creighton.
Scheierman averages 8.5 minutes and three points per game for the Celtics this season but is valued for future potential.

title: Keion White admits he wasn’t fit for Patriots’ scheme, while 49ers want to tap into ‘limitless potential’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots traded Keion White and a seventh-round pick to the 49ers for a sixth-round pick.
Keion White struggled with playing time in 2025 Patriots season, recording only six tackles and no sacks.
49ers impressed by White's potential, believing he fits their defensive scheme as an inside rusher.

title: Save money during New England travel in November
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Bluebird Talta Lodge in Stowe offers a Black Friday discount for travel between November 28 and December 1.
Newport Restaurant Week features prix-fixe menus, while Friendly's and Margaritas offer dining discounts for veterans on November 11.
The MBTA provides fare-free bus routes 23, 28, and 29 in Boston through February 28, 2026, in partnership with the city.

title: On the Cape and Islands, a new housing fix is gaining traction
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Cape and Islands towns propose real estate transfer fees on luxury home sales to fund affordable housing solutions.
Local leaders face opposition from real estate lobbyists concerned that transfer fees would harm the housing market and homeownership costs.
Median home prices on Martha's Vineyard and Nantucket highlight the affordability crisis; Nantucket's median price exceeds $3 million.

title: Meet the vampire who went viral during a visit to Salem
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Matthew Pruno, a Long Island cosplayer, went viral after his vampire look was posted in the Wicked Salem Facebook group.
His social media following grew to over 15,000 across platforms after the viral post identified him in Salem, Massachusetts.
Pruno has been cosplaying as Louis from 'Interview with a Vampire' for years, attending events like NYC Halloween Parade.
